intro: Tanarius cissifolius, commonly known as the African cissifolius, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or forested areas.
